ls: er, oops
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5748 <-- this is the problem I'm having with xorg.
(after upgrading dapper and installing wacom-tools)
it might not even be a dapper problem.
it looks like something stupid happened with respect to something changing stuff on my xorg to support the tablet device in my convertible laptop
or at least that's what I surmise
new input device, makes all the other input devices go wonky.
the xorg config is the same syntax as xf86config?
AFAIK, which isn't very well.
basically, the input devices section is pretty easy to suss out, the server section is where the devices are activated
it claims that there are no such drivers as "kbd" and "mouse."
okay... I see the two pointer devices..., the keyboard area looks okay....
ah.. kpd is missing from the modules list... just need to edit the file and toss it in there...
also, you know you're only running in 16 bit mode?
also, it looks like you're not using the nvidia binary driver...
like I said, just edit the modules section to re-add kdm to the list.. your keyboard input device is setup correctly...
I just did that and nothing changed.
did you restart X?
okay, back up your existing config. do a apt-reconfigure on the package
then re-add the lines for your touchpad
I'm an old X head, I always aim to edit the file first...
get's the sys admin's  attention and the account get's nuked ;)
still goofin on the keyboard is it?
